intro: Matelea nielsenii, commonly known as the Nielsen's matelea, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, with five petals and a prominent crown. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky soils. Its botanical characteristics make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
